title: African Markets - Factors to watch on Sept 4
text:
© Reuters. African Markets - Factors to watch on Sept 4

NAIROBI, Sept 4 (Reuters) - The following company announcements, scheduled economic

indicators, debt and currency market moves and political events may affect African markets on

Wednesday.

- - - - -

GLOBAL MARKETS

Asian stocks bounced on Wednesday, led by Chinese markets

after a report showed growth in the country's service sector

accelerating despite broader economic headwinds, while the

pound halted its decline on hopes a no-deal Brexit may yet

be averted. MKTS/GLOB

WORLD OIL PRICES

Oil prices recovered some ground on Wednesday after touching

their lowest in close to a month during the previous session

on concerns that a weakening global economy could depress

demand. O/R

EMERGING MARKETS

For the top emerging markets news, double click on

STOCKS

For the latest news on African stocks, click on .J

SOUTH AFRICA MARKETS

South Africa's rand firmed on Tuesday, buoyed by data

showing the economy grew more than expected in the second

quarter after a shock contraction previously. ECONOMY

Nigeria's economic growth slowed to an annual rate of 1.94%

in the three months to the end of June, the second quarter

in a row of decline as the country struggles to shake off

the effects of a recession it escaped two years

ago. MARKETS

The Kenyan shilling eased on Tuesday due to increased

dollar demand from merchandise importers and excess

liquidity in the money markets, traders said. POLITICS

A coalition of Ethiopian opposition parties on Tuesday

threatened to boycott a national vote next year without

changes to an electoral law they view as biased towards the

ruling party. MINING

Zambia should keep mineral royalties capped at 7.5% in the

2020 budget to safeguard the health of the mining sector and

promote additional investment, the Chamber of Mines said on
